Columbia University in the City of New York
Professor of Computer Science (and by courtesy, Electrical Engineering)
Co-founded this joint program between the Columbia Computer Science and Electrical Engineering Departments.  The program initially had a BS degree, and more recently an MS degree was added.

This new research center at Columbia University brings together over 45 researchers in three areas:  (i) large-scale and heterogeneous computing systems (hardware, parallel architectures, programming environments, databases), (ii) data science (AI, machine learning), and (iii) key computational application areas in science, medicine and engineering (astrophysics, ocean/climate science, physics, biomedical informatics, genomics, large-scale engineering projects [aging infrastructure, national energy grid]).   The center aims to foster collaborative research, form closer connections to national laboratories and research institutes, and serve as a nexus on campus to explore the application of computer systems and data science to large-scale scientific problems.
(The center was formerly a working group from 2016-2018, called "Frontiers in Computing Systems".)
In June 2019, we co-organized the "NY Scientific Data Summit", a major regional symposium, jointly with Brookhaven National Laboratory's Computational Science Inititative.

We had recorded videos of the instructor's lectures from the 2013 semester, and we processed these and reformatted the course content in order to allow students in the 2014 semester to watch the lectures at home.
